messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Abortion, PLEASE not on this list!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/13/03 9:21:08 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Yeah, its not the topic that is inappropiate as much as the way folks feel they have to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/13/03 9:21:08 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Earthmomma67@... writes:

> I truly think this is a very very inappropriate topic for this list. I
> highly
> doubt that this can be discussed dipassionately when even some of the ones
> asking for the debate to stop are adding statements designed to inflame
> others.
>

Yeah, its not the topic that is inappropiate as much as the way folks feel
they have to "defend" thier opinions. The "big people killing little people"
comment was def intended to flame and get the last word in.. THAT was
inappropiate ( IMO)

Teresa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Abortion, PLEASE not on this list!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/13/03 8:55:49 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... I agree completely. As the bumper sticker on the back of my car says:  Abortion:  Big ... So
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/13/03 8:55:49 AM Eastern Standard Time,
tlandreth@... writes:

> If you've had no first hand experience with abortion, you can discuss it
> without alot of emotion. But for those who have had experience, it's an
> extremely emotional subject and not one worth discussing on an unschooling
> list.

I agree completely.
As the bumper sticker on the back of my car says: Abortion: Big
>
> People KILLING Little People
>
> Suzy
>
>
>
So why do you go on to say something so emotional and inflammatory?
not one worth discussing on an unschooling
list.
As the bumper sticker on the back of my car says: Abortion: Big
>
> People KILLING Little People
>
Trying to get the last word in?
*~*Elissa Jill*~*
unschooling Momma to 3 beautiful brilliant people
Loving partner for life to Joey
terrible guitarist, fair singer and happy woman.

messages.subject: Abortion, PLEASE not on this list!
messages.messageBody:
<I can certainly understand where this can get messy yet understand the idea
behind questioning how this follows the unschooling philosophy. She's not
getting religious or even political about it. Just inquiring.>

If you've had no first hand experience with abortion, you can discuss it
without alot of emotion. But for those who have had experience, it's an
extremely emotional subject and not one worth discussing on an unschooling
list. As the bumper sticker on the back of my car says: Abortion: Big
People KILLING Little People

Suzy
